verses.verse: I made up my mind, myself, about this, that I would not come to you again with sadness,
for if I make you sad, who is the one who will make me happy, but those very ones who were made sad by me?
So I wrote the same to you, fearing that when I came, I would be sad because of those whom I should have been rejoicing in, for I had confidence in you all that my joy is your joy.
For out of a great burden and anguish of heart, I wrote to you with many tears, not that you would be made very sad, but that you might know the great love which I have for you.
But if anyone has caused somebody to be very sad, he hasn't made me sad, only this, so that I may not be overly severe with you all.
This punishment is sufficient for such a man by the majority,
so that now you should forgive and comfort instead, lest this one would be overwhelmed by excessive sorrow.
Therefore, I plead with you to reaffirm love for him.
I also write for this reason, so that I might test you whether you are obedient in everything.
Anyone whom you forgive, I forgive also, for if I forgive anything--to the one whom I forgave--it has been for your sake in the presence of Christ,
fearing that Satan would take advantage of us, for we are not ignorant of his evil plans.
Furthermore, when I came to Troas to preach Christ's Gospel and a door was open for me by the Lord,
I had no rest in my spirit, because I didn't find Titus, my brother, so saying goodbye to them, I went to Macedonia.
[I give] thanks to God who always causes us to give the victor's shout in Christ and makes clear the fragrance of his knowledge through us everywhere.
For we are a sweet fragrance of Christ to God both to those who are saved and those who perish.
To the one [we are] the fragrance of death to death and to the other the fragrance of life to life. Who is competent for such things?
We are not like many who corrupt the Word of God but of purity as from God; in God's sight we speak about Christ.
